intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. pallidopsis, commonly known as the pale-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant features basal and stem leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are accompanied by bracts. It is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
